text: springtime is prime time for English
peas they're crisp tender and sweet
they're usually sold in the pod but if
you're lucky like me you can find them
already shelled that's the hard part
and the first step whenever you're using
them is to blanch them I'm doing
something a little unusual today and
making vegetarian burgers loaded with
these delicious healthy Peas have a pot
of boiling water and add your Peas I
have a cup here for this recipe and you
just want them to boil until they're
bright green that takes about three to
four minutes
now you should have at the ready an ice
water bath and what that will do is it
stops the cooking and a little trick if
you have a colander like this slip it
into your ice water bath before you put
the peas in that way you won't be
fishing around for the peas and trying
to separate them from the ice cubes
these are already taking on a brighter
color it'll also make them a little more
tender and creamy so that when we blend
them with the other ingredients you'll
have that nice creamy meaty burger
texture that you want yep these look
terrific here vibrantly colored into the
ice water bath they go if you've made
vegetarian burgers before you probably
know that they usually have a million in
one ingredients in them what I love
about this recipe is that it's really so
simple and delicious with very few
ingredients to form the base of the
patties the peas go in that we've
blanched and half a cup of cooked
chickpeas you could certainly just buy
these in a can and drain them rinse them
first though and these just get a quick
pulse just to combine you want them a
little chunky not totally pure aid dump
this mixture right into a bowl look how
colorful this already is add to that
half a teaspoon of salt a cup of
breadcrumbs these are dry finely ground
breadcrumbs you could certainly use
fresh if you have them 2 tablespoons of
finely chopped parsley 1/2 a cup of
minced onion and 1 large egg that's just
lightly beaten the egg acts as a binder
so it's important to have that here and
just gently fold this all together until
it forms a uniform mixture this may look
a little dry and crumbly to you just now
but not to worry once we press these
together in our hands and form the patty
that they'll hold together nicely so
divide the mixture roughly
corridors this makes four and any time
I'm forming patties or meatballs even
vegetarian I like to have a little bowl
of water on hand I just find that
whatever you're working with doesn't
stick to your hands this way just to
coat and scoop some of it up and as you
can see it comes together beautifully
into a patties form it into a ball first
it's a little easier this way
pressing together tightly then you can
just gently flatten the patty you could
certainly make these and store them
covered in the refrigerator for a day or
two just like this and then you'll
practically have dinner ready okay let's
get cooking for the cooking of the
burgers have a nonstick skillet
preheating over medium and this will
need 1 to 2 tablespoons of olive oil and
just swirl it around to evenly coat the
skillet and in go the burgers you should
hear a sizzle I do you want to build a
little bit of a crust on either side
it'll help to offset the creamy interior
and since this is all vegetarian it
doesn't have to cook to an internal
temperature it just has to cook until
it's warm through and has a nice crust
on the other side so about four minutes
per side is all it needs
these are smelling terrific so just very

I love these flexible spatulas for this

they're more forgiving than a stiff

but why not make it even more delicious
and add some harissa this is half a cup
of mayonnaise into that two tablespoons
of harissa this is a North African chili
paste that's blended with garlic and
spices it's really delicious and just
stir it about takes on a beautiful color
I like to use really soft brioche buns
like this generously put some of this

but it's a mellow spice because the

cucumbers
sliced into thin rounds you could do
